pageDescriptions./: Powerful platform for automating Excel calculations according to IFRS. With ATABAI, financial reporting will be tens of times cheaper and faster.
pageDescriptions./dashboard: ATABAI Dashboard - manage files, IFRS templates and monitor the processing of financial documents.
pageDescriptions./templates: IFRS templates for automating depreciation calculations, discounts, asset impairment and financial reports.
pageDescriptions./profile: ATABAI user profile settings - manage subscription, preferences and personal data.
pageDescriptions./history: File processing history in ATABAI - view results, download processed documents and statistics.
pageDescriptions./processing: Processing Excel files according to IFRS standards - applying automation formulas and generating reports.
pageDescriptions./results: ATABAI file processing results - compare changes, detailed reports and export ready documents.
pageDescriptions./coming-soon: ATABAI will be available soon. The Excel calculation automation platform for IFRS is under development.
pageDescriptions./auth/success: Completing your authentication to ATABAI platform
pageDescriptions./settings: ATABAI user settings - manage preferences, subscription and account details
pageDescriptions./help: Get help and support for ATABAI - contact us for questions about IFRS automation
pageDescriptions./upload: Upload your Excel file to transform from NSBU to IFRS format with automated calculations

hero.title: Powerful platform for automating Excel calculations according to IFRS
hero.subtitle: With ATABAI, financial reporting will be tens of times cheaper and faster

step1.title: Upload Excel files
step1.description: Upload your financial Excel files for processing according to IFRS requirements
step1.uploadText: Drag files here or click to select

step2.title: Select IFRS template
step2.description: Choose the appropriate calculation template in accordance with IFRS

step3.title: Get ready results
step3.description: Download processed files with applied IFRS formulas and detailed change reports

step4.title: 4. See the transformation
step4.description: Watch how your local format transforms into international IFRS standards

templates.depreciationDescription: Automate depreciation calculations according to IAS 16 standards with high precision and compliance
templates.discountsDescription: Calculate revenue discounts and adjustments per IFRS 15 with automatic recognition rules
templates.impairmentDescription: Perform comprehensive impairment testing and calculations according to IAS 36 requirements
templates.reportsDescription: Generate comprehensive IFRS-compliant financial reports with automated compliance checks
templates.balance-sheetDescription: Transform NSBU balance sheet to IFRS format according to IAS 1 standards

automation.title: Complete Automation
automation.description: Automatic application of IFRS formulas to your Excel files

compliance.title: IFRS Compliance
compliance.description: Compliance with international financial reporting standards

easy.title: Easy to Use
easy.description: Intuitive interface requires no special training

universal.title: Universal
universal.description: Suitable for any type of calculation and report

pricing.title: ATABAI helps you save time and money

cta.title: Try now for free
cta.subtitle: For any of your tasks and see the effectiveness of ATABAI

finalCta.title: Ready to start?
finalCta.subtitle: Start automating your IFRS calculations today

comingSoon.title: Launching Soon!
comingSoon.description: We're working hard to create the best platform for IFRS calculation automation. Our team is finalizing all features to provide you with an exceptional experience.
comingSoon.contactDescription: Contact us for more information or to be notified about the launch.

depreciation: Excel file with asset data in NSBU format
Columns: Asset Name, Original Cost, Purchase Date, Useful Life
Each row should represent one asset
discounts: Excel file with revenue/discount data in NSBU format
Columns: Transaction ID, Revenue Amount, Discount Type, Discount Value
impairment: Excel file with asset carrying values in NSBU format
Columns: Asset Name, Carrying Value, Fair Value, Cash Flow Data
balance-sheet: Excel file with NSBU balance sheet format (Form № 1 - ОКУД 0710001)
Standard Uzbek balance sheet structure expected
Columns: Row Code, Description, Beginning Balance, Ending Balance
System will map NSBU codes to IFRS classifications

sampleFormat.title: Sample Excel Format
sampleFormat.description: Your Excel file should have similar column structure. The system will automatically detect columns and apply IFRS transformations.

statusDescription.pending: Your file is in queue for processing
statusDescription.processing: Applying IFRS transformations to your data
statusDescription.completed: File successfully processed and ready for download
statusDescription.failed: An error occurred while processing the file

stuck.statusDescription: Your file processing appears to be stuck or taking longer than expected.
stuck.title: Processing Appears Stuck
stuck.description: Your file has been processing for an unusually long time. This sometimes happens with very large files or temporary server issues.
stuck.suggestions: You can try uploading the file again, or contact support if this problem continues.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting Tips:
troubleshooting.tip1: Large files (>10MB) may take several minutes to process
troubleshooting.tip2: Complex calculations require more processing time
troubleshooting.tip3: Server maintenance may temporarily slow processing

error.title: Error Loading File
error.fetchFailed: Failed to load file details. Please try again.

comparison.originalFormat: Original format from your uploaded file
comparison.ifrsFormat: IFRS compliant format with applied transformations

depreciation.1: All depreciation calculations follow IAS 16 - Property, Plant and Equipment standards
depreciation.2: Carrying amounts represent cost less accumulated depreciation and impairment losses
depreciation.3: Depreciation rates are based on estimated useful lives and residual values
depreciation.4: Impairment tests are recommended for assets with indicators of impairment

discounts.1: All revenue recognition follows IFRS 15 - Revenue from Contracts with Customers
discounts.2: Transaction prices are adjusted for variable consideration including discounts
discounts.3: Revenue recognition timing is determined based on performance obligation satisfaction
discounts.4: Contract liabilities represent obligations to transfer goods/services

impairment.1: All impairment testing follows IAS 36 - Impairment of Assets standards
impairment.2: Recoverable amount is the higher of fair value less costs to sell and value in use
impairment.3: Impairment loss is recognized when carrying amount exceeds recoverable amount
impairment.4: Cash generating units (CGUs) are identified for assets that do not generate independent cash flows

balance-sheet.1: Balance sheet transformed from NSBU to IFRS format according to IAS 1 - Presentation of Financial Statements
balance-sheet.2: Current/non-current classification follows the 12-month operating cycle test
balance-sheet.3: All NSBU account codes have been mapped to appropriate IFRS line items
balance-sheet.4: This mapping provides structure alignment but does not replace full IFRS adjustments and professional audit

history.title: File History
history.subtitle: View and manage all your processed files
